Prey: Rodents, moose, bison, elk, caribou, sheep, mountain goats, deer, beavers, salmon, rabbits, squirrels, vole, and lemmings.
Fun Fact: Will travel up to 70 miles in a single day.
Biggest Threat: Grizzly bears, polar bears, tigers, scavengers, and humans.
Other Name(s): Northwestern wolf, Mackenzie Valley wolf, Rocky Mountain wolf, Alaskan timber wolf, or Canadian timber wolf.
Predators: Grizzly bears, polar bears, tigers, scavengers, and humans.
Lifespan: 6-8 years, though some can live up to 17 years in captivity
Age of Sexual Maturity: 2 years for females, 3 years for males.
Name: Mackenzie Wolf
